articles.author: Shraddha shetty
articles.description:
Recently, I had the opportunity to explore a series of hands-on labs using Google‚Äôs Vertex AI, specifically focusing on generative AI capabilities. Over a few short sessions, I built and tested applications that could analyze images, generate visuals from text, and simulate human-like chat ‚Äî all using pre-trained models like Gemini and Imagen

Generative AI on Vertex AI (also known as genAI or gen AI) gives you access to Google‚Äôs large generative AI models so you can test, tune, and deploy them for use in your AI-powered applications.
In this lab, you will:
Connect to Vertex AI: Learn how to establish a connection to Google Cloud‚Äôs AI platform using the Vertex AI SDK. 
Work with Pre-trained Models: Use powerful, pre-trained generative models like Gemini for text and image understanding, an‚Ä¶
articles.title: Building AI-Powered Image Apps with Gemini and Imagen on Vertex AI

articles.author: Pooja Gujwar
articles.description:
What I Understand from SQL vs NoSQL



  
  
  SQL(Structured Query Language)


SQL is a database that stores data in a vertical way. In SQL databases, you store data in the form of row and columns. The first row contains fields, and the next row contain data for those fields. So it's like adding data vertically.
SQL is mostly used in applications where you already know the structure of the data before storing it. For example, if you want to store user data or banking data, you can use a SQL database.
NoSQL is a database that stores data in horizontal way. In this, data is stored in JSON format, and you can have as many fields as you want. It is generally faster compared to SQL.
When you have dynamic data with multiple fields, you use a NoSQL database. For example, when storing product dat‚Ä¶
articles.title: SQL Vs NoSQL

articles.author: Shruti Saraswat
articles.description:
Method 1: Use an Online Transcription Tool That Accepts YouTube URLs


The easiest route (especially if you‚Äôre not into setting up local software) is using an online tool that accepts YouTube links directly and converts the video into clean, structured text.
One that I‚Äôve personally used is TurboTranscript. It doesn‚Äôt require any downloads ‚Äî just paste the video URL, and it:
    Transcribes the audio to text
    Offers speaker-wise formatting (very helpful for panel discussions or interviews)
    Lets you export the transcript as PDF, or generate SRT/VTT subtitles
    Supports translation into 130+ languages for global learning
    Automatically creates a summary if you‚Äôre just looking for the key takeaways
It also includes a free 15-minute trial, which works well if you're working with sh‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Get a Transcript of a YouTube Lecture (Without Downloading Anything)

articles.author: Prema Ananda
articles.description:
This is a submission for the Postmark Challenge: Inbox Innovators
Meet MailMap - a revolutionary web application that transforms the simple act of sending an email into creating interactive, location-based stories on Google Maps. Users can share photos and memories by simply sending an email to a special address. The app automatically extracts location data from photo EXIF, publishes content on an interactive map, and builds a community-driven platform with voting and moderation features.
üåê Live Demo: https://mailmap.premananda.site/
In our social media-dominated world, location-based storytelling often requires complex interfaces, multiple steps, and platform-specific knowledge. What if sharing a moment from your travels could be as simple as sending an email? MailMap bridges the gap bet‚Ä¶
articles.title: MailMap: Transforming Emails into Interactive Stories on Google Maps üìçüìß

articles.author: Rishabh parmar
articles.description:
In a world where trust is becoming a rare currency and centralized control often leads to bottlenecks, inefficiencies, or censorship, public blockchains have emerged as a revolutionary force. They‚Äôre not just technological innovations‚Äîthey're a movement toward transparency, decentralization, and freedom. From Bitcoin to Ethereum and beyond, public blockchains are transforming how we share data, transfer assets, and verify truth in the digital era.
What Is a Public Blockchain?
Key Features That Make Public Blockchains Unstoppable
Decentralization
Public blockchains run on thousands of nodes distributed across the globe. No single person, company, or government controls the network. This lack of central authority means there‚Äôs no single point of failure, making the system resilient against c‚Ä¶
articles.title: Unlocked and Unstoppable: The Power of Public Blockchains

articles.author: Pratham naik
articles.description:
**Originally published* on*¬†Teamcamp Blog
Taking over an existing project is one of the most challenging scenarios any developer or team lead can face. Whether you're stepping in due to a sudden departure, organizational restructuring, or a struggling initiative, the pressure to maintain momentum while establishing your leadership can be overwhelming.
Having navigated several mid-project transitions throughout my career, I've learned that success depends on a methodical approach that balances respect for existing work with necessary improvements. Today, I want to share the essential strategies that have helped me‚Äîand can help you‚Äîmaster the art of project takeovers.
The Foundation: Understanding What You've Inherited



Your first priority should always be comprehensive project discovery. ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Taking Over a Project Mid-Stream: A Developer's Guide to Seamless Leadership Transitions

articles.author: upendragurugubelli
articles.description:
Recently, I carried out a migration from Kubernetes Ingress to Gateway API for one of our production workloads. This post is a distilled summary of the lessons learned, the approach taken, and key insights you might find helpful if you‚Äôre considering or planning a similar transition.
The Kubernetes Gateway API is not just an incremental improvement over Ingress. It‚Äôs a rethinking of how routing and traffic control should work in modern, scalable Kubernetes environments. It introduces a more expressive and extensible model, enabling:
Separation of concerns: Decouple infrastructure and application layer routing more cleanly.


Rich routing capabilities: HTTP routing, header matching, path rewriting, traffic splitting, and more.


Better role-based access control: Via resource boundaries betw‚Ä¶
articles.title: Migrating from Ingress to Gateway API: Lessons from the Trenches

articles.author: Dev Gaurav Jatt
articles.description:
üìö Supercharge Your Drizzle ORM Workflow with drizzle-setup CLI


Setting up a modern ORM for your project should be fast, reliable, and flexible. That‚Äôs where drizzle-setup cli comes in ‚Äî a powerful utility to automatically scaffold your Drizzle ORM setup for PostgreSQL, SQLite, MySQL, and more.
Whether you‚Äôre working on a side project or spinning up a production-ready stack, drizzle-setup ensures a frictionless experience from zero to fully-configured.
drizzle-setup?


Here‚Äôs what makes this CLI a game-changer:
üì¶ Zero Config Setup ‚Äì Get started with just a few prompts.


üìú Drizzle Scripts ‚Äì Automatically populates your package.json with useful Drizzle CLI commands.


üîß .env Auto Update ‚Äì Adds all essential environment variables without manual hassle.


üß© Multi-DB Support ‚Äì Works with PostgreSQL, SQLite, MySQL, and more.


üìÅ Template Copying ‚Äì Sets up your schema.ts and index.ts instantly.







  
  
  üì¶ Installation


You can install globally using your favorite package manager:
npm install -g drizzle-setup
# or use npx for one-time setup
npx drizzle-setup

In your project root, run:
drizzle-setup

You‚Äôll be guided through:
Selecting a database (PostgreSQL, SQLite, etc.)


Choosing a preset config


Setting the target folder


Copying boilerplate files


Generating drizzle.config.ts


Updating .env and package.json


Installing required dependencies







  
  
  üß™ Supported Databases




PostgreSQL: Default, Neon, PlanetScale and more.


SQLite: Default, Turso, Bun SQLite and more.


MySQL: Default, Turso, Bun SQLite and more.



Each choice is tailored with optimal templates and .env configs.
Once setup completes, your project might look like this:
project-root/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ drizzle.config.ts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .env
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [target-folder]/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ schema.ts
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ index.ts


Ready to skip the boilerplate and get building?
npx drizzle-setup

Drop your suggestions or issues in the GitHub repo or tweet with the hashtag #DrizzleSetupCLI.
articles.title: Zero-Config DB Setup with Drizzle ORM Using drizzle-setup CLI

articles.author: Sainath Patil
articles.description:
Introduction
Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) is a core practice in modern DevOps workflows. While GitHub Actions provides powerful cloud-hosted runners, sometimes you need more control over the build environment ‚Äî for cost savings, performance, or custom setups.
In this tutorial, we‚Äôll walk through setting up a self-hosted GitHub Actions runner on an AWS EC2 instance, and then use it to deploy a simple Node.js app automatically. You‚Äôll learn how to:
Launch and configure an EC2 instance


Register it as a GitHub self-hosted runner


Set up a secure deployment pipeline



By the end, you‚Äôll have a working CI/CD system running on your own AWS infrastructure.
‚úÖ 1. Prerequisites
AWS account


GitHub account


Basic knowledge of Node.js & Linux


SSH key setup




‚úÖ 2. Launching and Preparing the EC2 Instance
Choose Amazon Linux 2 or Ubuntu


Configure instance (t2.micro for testing)


Open required ports (e.g., SSH, app port)


SSH into EC2 and install:
First update EC2 sudo apt update

Install Docker sudo apt-get install docker.io -y









‚úÖ 3. Installing and Registering GitHub Self-Hosted Runner
Go to your GitHub repo ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Actions ‚Üí Runners


Choose Linux x64


Download and configure the runner on EC2




‚úÖ 4. Setting Up the CI/CD Workflow
Add at root level of your project.github/workflows/deploy.yml


Refer this repo for yml file GitHub




‚úÖ 5. Testing and Verifying Deployment
Push code to main branch


Watch self-hosted runner logs


Check if app is running (via browser or curl)




‚úÖ 6. Troubleshooting Tips
Open the required ports in AWS security group
‚úÖ 7. Conclusion
What you‚Äôve accomplished:
EC2 instance as GitHub runner
CI/CD using your infrastructure
Benefits of self-hosted vs GitHub-hosted runners
Scale to multiple EC2 runners
Add database integration
‚úÖ 8. Resources & Links
GitHub
articles.title: CI/CD with GitHub Actions Using AWS self-hosted Runner

articles.author: asim-builds
articles.description:
Hi everyone! üëã
What the App Does
Graphical Interface (Tkinter) -> Has one tab for sender and one tab for receiver.
Sender Side -> The sender side has the following features: Auto-discovers hosts on the local network, manual ip entry if preferred, port  selection, drag and drop support, manual file browsing, and file integrity check using hash verification.
Receiver Side -> The receiver side has the following features: Choose listening port, selecting folder to save received files and start/stop receiving buttons.
This project uses socket, threading, tkinterdnd2, and a few other standard Python libraries - no external dependencies.
Why I built it?
spend hours going through tutorials, blog posts, or watching videos, but I rarely built anything concrete. I‚Äôd get stuck in the cycle of consumi‚Ä¶
